title: Elizabeth Holmes: What Happens Next to Theranos Founder Found Guilty of Fraud
sub_head: Holmes was convicted on four of 11 counts; sentencing is set for September
body:
Elizabeth Holmes, the founder of Theranos Inc., was found guilty Jan. 3 on four counts of criminal fraud against investors. She was acquitted on four counts tied to patients. The jury was unable to reach a unanimous verdict on the remaining three counts tied to investors.
On Jan. 12, the federal judge overseeing Ms. Holmes’s case scheduled her sentencing hearing for Sept. 26. She will remain out of prison until at least that time with a $500,000 bond secured by property owned by her parents—an apartment on Wisconsin Avenue in Washington, D.C., according to public records.
